story:
Once upon a time, in the beautiful land of Egypt, there was a young boy named Ahmed. Ahmed was a kind and curious boy who loved to explore the world around him. He lived in a small village near the Nile River, where he would spend his days playing with his friends and helping his family with their farm.

One day, while Ahmed was playing near the river, he noticed something shiny in the water. He waded in to take a closer look and saw that it was a beautiful golden scarab beetle. Ahmed had never seen anything like it before and he was immediately captivated by its beauty.

He picked up the scarab beetle and held it in the palm of his hand, admiring its intricate details and shiny golden color. Suddenly, the beetle began to move and Ahmed felt a strange sensation coursing through his body.

The beetle spoke to him in a soft, gentle voice, "Thank you for freeing me, Ahmed. I am the guardian of the ancient treasures of Egypt. As a reward, I will grant you three wishes. Choose wisely, my young friend."

Ahmed couldn't believe his ears. He had always dreamed of finding treasure and now he had the chance to wish for it. But he also knew that he had to be careful what he wished for.

After thinking for a moment, Ahmed made his first wish, "I wish for my family to never want for anything again."

The beetle nodded and granted his wish. Ahmed could see that his family's farm was now the most prosperous in the village and they had all the food and supplies they could ever need.

For his second wish, Ahmed asked, "I wish for all the children in my village to have access to education and books."

The beetle granted his wish and soon a beautiful school was built in the village, filled with books and eager students.

Finally, for his third wish, Ahmed thought long and hard. He had already wished for his family's prosperity and the education of the children in his village. He wanted his wish to benefit not just him, but everyone in Egypt.

And so, he made his final wish, "I wish for the beauty and wonder of Egypt to be preserved for generations to come."

The beetle smiled and granted his wish. From that day on, Egypt became a place where its history and culture were protected and preserved, and its people lived in prosperity and peace.

Ahmed went to bed that night with a grateful heart, knowing that he had used his wishes wisely and had helped make his beloved Egypt a better place for all.

And with that, my son, it's time for you to close your eyes and dream of all the wonderful things you can do to make the world a better place. Goodnight.
